page.title: 19The River Dee
page.content: The River Dee divides the area into two.There are only two ways to cross the river, one is a footbridge on private land, the other way is to go out of the area and over a bridge at Overton. The river is wide and there are no rocks to obstruct the current. On the banks of the river are a church and the Boat Inn. The river floods in the winter but it has never flooded the buildings. There is good fishing in the river which has salmon, trout, eel and grayling. Fly fishing is the best method of catching these fish. A day's fishing costs Â£2, provided you have a rod licence. Further up the river at Pen-y-lan there is private fishing for a syndicate which takes about 40 salmon a year.
